dcterms:creator: Barry C Arnold
dcterms:description: The Pareto distribution is a power-law probability distribution that is used to model phenomena where a small number of occurrences account for the majority of the effect, such as wealth distribution.
dcterms:title: Pareto Distribution

dcterms:creator: W. Zhang
M. Zhu
K. G. Derpanis
dcterms:description: The Penn Action Dataset consists of videos of people performing various actions, annotated with detailed action labels, making it suitable for action recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: Penn Action Dataset

dcterms:creator: H. Jhuang
J. Gall
S. Zufﬁ
C. Schmid
M. J. Black
dcterms:description: The Sub-JHMDB Dataset is a subset of the JHMDB dataset, focusing on action recognition with a smaller set of actions and videos, providing a more manageable dataset for training and evaluation.
dcterms:title: Sub-JHMDB Dataset

dcterms:description: The 4-armed Bandit Model θ4 is a theoretical model used in the context of multi-armed bandit problems, where an agent must choose between multiple options (arms) to maximize rewards.
dcterms:title: 4-armed Bandit Model θ4

dcterms:description: The 4-armed Bandit Model θ'4 is another theoretical model in the multi-armed bandit framework, similar to θ4 but with different parameters or configurations.
dcterms:title: 4-armed Bandit Model θ'4
